array.param: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.
time is seconds, in which the object will be faded in. If no speed is given, 1 is assumed.
false to hide the resource when the map is opened (default: true) Introduced in ARMA 3 .

syntax.param: layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100.

array.param: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.
time is seconds, in which the object will be faded in. If no speed is given, 1 is assumed.
false to hide the resource when the map is opened (default: true) Introduced in ARMA 3 .

syntax.param: layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE

array.param: one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See Title Effect Types for more information about these values.
time is seconds, in which the object will be faded in. If no speed is given, 1 is assumed.
false to hide the resource when the map is opened (default: true) Introduced in ARMA 3 .
